snippet: Twitter made public its prospectus for an initial public offering, providing a glimpse at the high-flying company’s financial health. | Big banks are guarding against possible mayhem from a debt ceiling crisis. | The White House has begun to vet T...
lead_paragraph: TWITTER OPENS UP  |  Twitter on Thursday made public its prospectus for an initial public offering, providing a glimpse at the high-flying company’s financial health. The filing showed just how central smartphones and tablets are to Twitter’s business, underscoring the technology industry’s shift to a mobile world, Vindu Goel and Michael J. de la Merced report in DealBook. But despite evidence that Twitter is increasing its revenue from mobile advertising, the company also showed that it has not yet turned a profit, and has been steadily losing money, and that its user growth has been slowing since the end of last year.
